questions.question: If the number of n selected input lines is equal to 2^n then it requires  _____________  select lines.

explanations.b: If there are 2^n input lines, then n select lines are needed to uniquely address each input line in a multiplexer.

questions.question: Which of the following can be used as a parallel to series converter?

explanations.a: A multiplexer can act as a parallel to series converter by selecting and transmitting multiple parallel inputs one at a time over a single output line.

questions.question: In a multiplexer, the output depends on its _____________ .

explanations.d: In a multiplexer, the output is determined by the select inputs, which choose which data input is routed to the output.

questions.question: Stuck at fault relies on input and output values at that terminal.

explanations.b: Stuck-at fault testing involves applying specific test vectors to detect faults, not relying solely on the actual input and output values at a terminal. The fault is assumed to be permanently stuck at a logic level, and test patterns are designed to reveal discrepancies in circuit behavior.

questions.question: Multiplexers are also referred to as  _____________ .

explanations.a: Multiplexers are commonly referred to as data selectors because they select one of several input signals and forward it to a single output line based on select inputs.
